I took a look and only 2 out of the 10 callers to AbstractSourceContainer#getDirector() check if it 
returns null. Everywhere else assumes that it can't be null, despite the JavaDoc warning to the 
contrary.

I'm not sure what the right behavior should be in some cases when getDirector() returns null. Most 
notably, there are a couple cases where we create ISourceContainers and then call 
init(getDirector()) on them. If getDirector() returns null should we just not call init or are we better 
off not even creating the ISourceContainers in the first place?

Just FYI.

Leo, do you have steps to reproduce this consistently? (an example program, 
watch expression?) When I try debugging with a watch expression, I do not get 
the errors listed (it looks like your source locator is not initialized for 
some reason).

All I did is going to launch configuration for Debug and checking

[x] Search for duplicates ....

on Sources page.

Than just try to debug Eclipse 3.0 build from sources under 3.0.

Especially trying to pause the process (not individual threads) and than
expanding threads nodes and clicking on the stack frames.

Hope this helps.

I have been unable to reproduce the NPE, but looking at the code, I beleive it 
is a multi-threaded race condition causing the problem. The launch view and a 
watch expression are both performing a source lookup at the same time. The 
first time there is a source lookup for a composite source container (default 
source lookup path), the source path will be computed, which creates and 
initializes source containers. However, the method "getSourceContainers(...)" 
in CompositeSourceContainer is not synchronized. Thus, one thread could create 
the containers and the other thread could access the containers before they 
are completely initialized (i.e. with the source lookup director).

Fixed by making CompositeSourceContainer.getSourceContainers() synchronized.
Please verify, Kevin. (Also released to 3.0.1 branch).

Thanks for the fix. Raicing might have been exactly the source of problem 
because I run on HyperThreaded XP.
